name: Codenames
description: Codenames is a game of guessing which 'codenames' (i.e., words) in a set are related to a hint-word given by another player. Players split into two teams: red and blue. One player of each team is selected as the team's spymaster; the others are field operatives.
basicRules: Twenty-five codename cards are laid out in a 5x5 grid.
The two spymasters are given a key card that shows them which cards belong to their team, which are neutral, and which one is the assassin.
The spymasters take turns giving one-word clues to their teammates. The clue should relate to one or more of the words on the grid that belong to their team.
The spymaster also gives a number, which tells their teammates how many words on the grid relate to the clue.

The teammates try to guess the correct words. If they guess a word that belongs to their team, they can keep guessing. If they guess a neutral word or a word that belongs to the other team, their turn ends. If they guess the assassin, their team immediately loses.
The first team to guess all of their words wins the game.
tips: As the spymaster, try to give clues that link multiple words.
As a guesser, don't be afraid to discuss the clue with your teammates.
Be careful not to guess the assassin!
